column1: PSI #04 Death Rate among Surgical Inpatients with Serious Treatable Complications

Surgical discharges, for patients ages 18 through 89 years or MDC 14 (pregnancy, childbirth, and puerperium), with all of the following:
• any-listed ICD-9-CM or ICD-10-PCS procedure codes for an operating room procedure; and
• the principal procedure occurring within 2 days of admission or an admission type of elective (ATYPE=3); and
• any secondary ICD-9-CM or ICD-10-CM diagnosis codes for pneumonia.

Surgical discharges are defined by specific DRG or MS-DRG codes.

column4: Pneumonia due to Methicillin susceptible Staphylococcus aureus
Pneumonia due to Methicillin resistant Staphylococcus aureus
Pneumonia due to streptococcus, group B
Pneumonia due to other aerobic Gram-negative bacteria
Pneumonia due to other specified bacteria
Pneumonitis due to inhalation of food and vomit

column2: DUE TO INHALATION OF FOOD OR VOMITUS
